title: Silicon Validation Engineer
summary: In this highly visible role, you will perform lab characterization and validation of various analog & mixed signal embedded circuits; and collaborate with multi-functional teams to launch the world's most premiere mobile SoC’s.
description: You will be part of a small team responsible for: Bench test, debug, and characterization of embedded on-chip circuitry (PLLs, DLLs, Clocks, Data Converters, DDR Memory, and various I/O Interfaces); Development of benchtop electrical tests exercising on-chip circuitry through a combination of FPGA, JTAG, SPI, and analog interfaces; Drafting & Execution of scripts to automate tests, extract results, and generate reports using database and analytical tools; Generating reports for characterization and/or debugging to provide design feedback; In-system PI/SI measurements for correlation with simulation models; Collaborating with cross functional teams including Design, System HW, and SW; Supporting ATE and Product Engineering.
key_qualifications: Experience in AMS test development that includes: review specification document; draft validation plan; build test bench; and perform data collection with automation; Strong fundamental understanding of analog & mixed signal circuitry in one or more of the following domains: PLL, Data Converter, DDR Memory, Temp Sensor, etc.; Proficient in lab instruments such as Oscilloscope, Spectrum Analyzer, Pattern Generator, etc.; Experienced in scripting language, Python preferred, to automate test and analyze data; Diligent & Emphasis on quality of results; Initiative in taking ownership & responsibility to drive deliverables; Strong verbal and written communication skills; Hands-on lab experience including soldering/instrumenting systems is a plus.
education_experience: BSEE is required plus a minimum 10 years of industry experience or equivalent Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity.
